comment_data.body: This one is actually very helpful when _writing_ code. (luals and luacheck are orthogonal, as they output at different times, so overlap is not harmful and even beneficial.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,7 +25,8 @@
     },
     "unusedLocalExclude": [ "_*" ],
     "disable": [
-      "luadoc-miss-see-name"
+      "luadoc-miss-see-name",
+      "unused-local"

comment_data.body: Ye, true. I guess we'll need to disable each warning separately then.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -25,7 +25,8 @@

     "unusedLocalExclude": [ "_*" ],
     "disable": [

comment_data.body: I don't think we would want to make it public, as such a exceptional case would be confusing and might cause other warnings (nil check?) for public use of `tbl_isarray`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -608,7 +608,7 @@ end
 ---@see |vim.tbl_isarray()|
 ---
 ---@param t table
----@return boolean `true` if list-like table, else `false`.
+---@return boolean|nil `true` if list-like table, else `false`.

comment_data.body: Can we document the behavior or meaning of `fun == nil`? Related #15460
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -645,7 +646,7 @@ local on_key_cbs = {}
 ---@note {fn} will not be cleared by |nvim_buf_clear_namespace()|
 ---@note {fn} will receive the keys after mappings have been evaluated
 ---
----@param fn fun(key: string) Function invoked on every key press. |i_CTRL-V|
+---@param fn fun(key: string)|nil Function invoked on every key press. |i_CTRL-V|

comment_data.body: I'm not sure about this change. There is no `{val}`, and this description feels better in the previous place.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1620,11 +1620,13 @@ vim.keycode({str})                                             *vim.keycode()*
       • |nvim_replace_termcodes()|
 
 vim.lua_omnifunc({find_start}, {_})                       *vim.lua_omnifunc()*
-    Omnifunc for completing Lua values from the runtime Lua interpreter,
-    similar to the builtin completion for the `:lua` command.
-
     Activate using `set omnifunc=v:lua.vim.lua_omnifunc` in a Lua buffer.
 
+    Parameters: ~
+      • {val}  (table) Omnifunc for completing Lua values from the runtime Lua
+               interpreter, similar to the builtin completion for the `:lua`
+               command.

comment_data.body: Uh, so should I just silence the warning from luals inside this function?

comment_data.body: Maybe yes, but I'm not very sure. Probably we may want to clean up this HACK instead; ref https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/16440/files#r1164167492 -- /cc @bfredl

comment_data.body: Well, what does it do? From a quick glance at the function it doesn't seem to do anything.

comment_data.body: Surely we just change this to only return a Boolean?

comment_data.body:
Yep, that TODO can be done now. Just delet this part of the code:
```lua
    -- TODO(bfredl): in the future, we will always be inside nvim
    -- then this check can be deleted.
    if vim._empty_dict_mt == nil then
      return nil
    end
```
and it will never return `nil`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -608,7 +608,7 @@ end
 ---@see |vim.tbl_isarray()|
 ---
 ---@param t table
----@return boolean `true` if list-like table, else `false`.
+---@return boolean|nil `true` if list-like table, else `false`.

comment_data.body: OK, deleted the todo.

comment_data.body:
From #15460 #15420 

`on_key()` to return a count when called with no args. But I'm not sure how we can best document this. Return count or return all the handlers? If it's still undecided, we could just leave them undocumented. /cc @justinmk
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -645,7 +646,7 @@ local on_key_cbs = {}

 ---@note {fn} will receive the keys after mappings have been evaluated
 ---
----@param fn fun(key: string) Function invoked on every key press. |i_CTRL-V|
+---@param fn fun(key: string)|nil Function invoked on every key press. |i_CTRL-V|

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  local gdbserver_port = os.getenv('GDBSERVER_PORT') or '7777'
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -67,7 +67,7 @@ if os.getenv('VALGRIND') then
 elseif os.getenv('GDB') then
   local gdbserver_port = '7777'
   if os.getenv('GDBSERVER_PORT') then
-    gdbserver_port = os.getenv('GDBSERVER_PORT')
+    gdbserver_port = assert(os.getenv('GDBSERVER_PORT'))
